Detailed Description

The InputMethodConnection is the communication channel from an InputMethod back to the application that is receiving its input.

It is used to perform such things as reading text around the cursor, committing text to the text box, and sending raw key events to the application. 

 #include <gaia/service/InputMethodConnection.h>
 using namespace gaia::service;

 InputMethodConnection* pImc = IMEService::getCurrentInputMethodConnection();
 int code = 100;
 pImc->commitText(String::valueOf((char16_t)code),1);

 delete pImc;

Member Function Documentation

virtual bool gaia::service::InputMethodConnection::beginBatchEdit ( ) [virtual]

Tell the editor that you are starting a batch of editor operations.

The editor will try to avoid sending you updates about its state until endBatchEdit is called.

Implements gaia::service::InputConnection.

virtual bool gaia::service::InputMethodConnection::clearMetaKeyStates ( int32_t  states) [virtual]

Clear the given meta key pressed states in the given input connection.

Parameters:
[in]statesThe states to be cleared, may be one or more bits as per KeyEvent.getMetaState().
Returns:
Returns true on success, false if the input connection is no longer valid.

Implements gaia::service::InputConnection.

virtual bool gaia::service::InputMethodConnection::deleteSurroundingText ( int32_t  beforeLength,
int32_t  afterLength 
) [virtual]

Delete beforeLength characters of text before the current cursor position, and delete afterLength characters of text after the current cursor position, excluding composing text.

Before and after refer to the order of the characters in the string, not to their visual representation.

Parameters:
[in]beforeLengthThe number of characters to be deleted before the current cursor position.
[in]afterLengthThe number of characters to be deleted after the current cursor position.
Returns:
Returns true on success, false if the input connection is no longer valid.

Implements gaia::service::InputConnection.

virtual int32_t gaia::service::InputMethodConnection::getCursorCapsMode ( int32_t  reqModes) const [virtual]

Retrieve the current capitalization mode in effect at the current cursor position in the text.

This method may fail either if the input connection has become invalid (such as its process crashing) or the client is taking too long to respond with the text (it is given a couple seconds to return). In either case, a 0 is returned.

Parameters:
[in]reqModesThe desired modes to retrieve, as defined by TextUtils.getCapsMode. These constants are defined so that you can simply pass the current TextBoxAttribute.contentType value directly in to here.
Returns:
Returns the caps mode flags that are in effect.

Implements gaia::service::InputConnection.

virtual gaia::text::Editable* gaia::service::InputMethodConnection::getEditableN ( ) const [virtual]

Return the target of edit operations.

The default implementation returns its own fake editable that is just used for composing text; subclasses that are real text editors should override this and supply their own.

virtual gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::service::InputMethodConnection::getSelectedTextN ( int32_t  flags) const [virtual]

The default implementation returns the text currently selected, or null if none is selected.

Parameters:
[in]flagsSupplies additional options controlling how the text is returned. May be either 0 or GET_TEXT_WITH_STYLES.
Returns:
Returns the text that is currently selected, if any, or null if no text is selected.

Implements gaia::service::InputConnection.

virtual gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::service::InputMethodConnection::getTextAfterCursorN ( int32_t  length,
int32_t  flags 
) const [virtual]

The default implementation returns the given amount of text from the current cursor position in the buffer.

Parameters:
[in]lengthThe expected length of the text.
[in]flagsSupplies additional options controlling how the text is returned. May be either 0 or GET_TEXT_WITH_STYLES.
Returns:
Returns the text after the cursor position; the length of the returned text might be less than n.

Implements gaia::service::InputConnection.

virtual bool gaia::service::InputMethodConnection::setComposingText ( const gaia::base::String &  text,
int32_t  newCursorPosition 
) [virtual]

The default implementation places the given text into the editable, replacing any existing composing text.

The new text is marked as in a composing state with the composing style.

Parameters:
[in]textThe string which is going to replacing the existing composing text.
Returns:
True for success, false if the input method connection is no longer valid.

Implements gaia::service::InputConnection.

virtual bool gaia::service::InputMethodConnection::setSelection ( int32_t  start,
int32_t  end 
) [virtual]

Set the selection of the text editor.

To set the cursor position, start and end should have the same value.

Returns:
Returns true on success, false if the input connection is no longer valid.
